result.execSummary:
The Governor of the State of Wisconsin has issued a pardon to the defendant for one or more of the charge(s) for which there was a conviction in this case. Although a pardon does not vacate or set aside a conviction, it does have the effect of restoring to the defendant all of the civil rights that would otherwise be lost as a result of the conviction. Please check the court record events to determine the precise charge(s) to which the pardon applies.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs.
Not to possess any firearms.
DNA surcharge WAIVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J Anny

records.addlTxt: With attached cover letter, filed by Governor Evers

No action by the Court.

  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 10/13/20 because that is the date it was mailed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph J Anny in court with attorney Ronald J Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail
- Restitution of $275.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph J Anny in court with attorney Ronald J Sonderhouse.  Kevin M Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Sonderhouse requests a plea/sentencing date in approximately 2 weeks. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph J Anny in court with attorney Ronald J Sonderhouse.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Sonderhouse was just appointed and requests another date. Atty. Sonderhouse just received discovery.  Hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Signed by Judge Hassin on 04/07/2014
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joseph J Anny in court.  Timothy A. Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advises he wants to accept the State's offer.   Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court grants request and will appoint Atty. Sonderhouse or Atty. Wolff if they accept the appointment. Defendant to make repayment at rate of $50.00 per month commencing May 1, 2014. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Joseph J Anny in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not wish to have counsel and would like to accept the state's pre-trial offer.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Joseph J Anny in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
